dublinCore.dc:title: 113 S2651 : DHS OIG Mandates Revision Act of 2014
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure, and in addition to the Committee on Homeland Security, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To repeal certain mandates of the Department of Homeland Security Office of Inspector General.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the DHS OIG Mandates Revision Act of 2014.

subsection.header: Repeal of requirement To conduct an annual evaluation of the cargo inspection targeting system

paragraph.text: Subsections (g) and (h) of section 809 of the Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation Act of 2004 (Public Law 108–293; 46 U.S.C. 70101 note) are repealed.
Section 809 of the Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation Act of 2004 (Public Law 108–293; 118 Stat. 1085), as amended by paragraph (1), is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking and (j) and inserting and (h); and
by redesignating subsections (i), (j), and (k) as subsections (g), (h), and (i), respectively.

subsection.header: Repeal of requirement To conduct an annual review of Coast Guard performance

paragraph.text: Section 888(f) of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 (6 U.S.C. 468(f)) is repealed.
Section 888 of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 (6 U.S.C. 468), as amended by paragraph (1), is amended by redesignating subsections (g), (h), and (i) as subsections (f), (g), and (h), respectively.

subsection.header: Annual review of grants to States and high-risk urban areas

paragraph.text: Section 2022(a)(3) of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 (6 U.S.C. 612(a)(3)) is repealed.
Section 2022(a) of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 (6 U.S.C. 612(a)), as amended by paragraph (1), is amended—

subparagraph.text: by redesignating paragraphs (4), (5), (6), and (7) as paragraphs (3), (4), (5), and (6), respectively;

clause.text: by striking paragraphs (2) and (3) and inserting paragraph (2); and
by striking paragraph (4) and inserting paragraph (3).

paragraph.text: The amendments made by this subsection shall take effect on January 1, 2015.

attestation-group.attestation-date: Passed the Senate September 17 (legislative day, September 16), 2014.
